answers.answer: You should call your ob it could be your blood pressure or it could be just from hormones but they need to check it out to be safe.

You definitely don't want to leave a severe headache untreated that long, so I'd say give your OB a call and either ask to be seen today or go to the urgent care, just because you don't want to be stuck through the long weekend without an answer.It could be blood-pressure, blood-sugar, or any number of things..but any headache that is unusual in frequency, length, or intensity during pregnancy should be treated just to make sure it's not something serious. It could well be hormones..I have HORRIBLE migraines that can last days, and when I'm pregnant, they can get worse to where I only have HOURS of relief between headache attacks.But nonetheless, it's very important to get checked out when this is not normal for you.Best of luck..keep us posted, OK?
I have the same problem I'm 18w4d with my third and I k

I would call your OB now and if they can't see you today then go to the ER. A headache could mean many different things.My OB said that upper side pain accompanied with headaches is a sign of preeclampsia.
An Oct been in bed all day I have been throwing.g up and everything .. its horrible.

question: I am 25 yrs old, 16 weeks, 5 days pregnant with my third child. All has been good up until now aside from the morning sickness, which was pretty brutal vomiting 2-3 times daily up until last week.  I had bad upper right side pain lasting 3 days 2 weeks ago.. shortly after that, i developed bad headaches, constant, it hasn't gone away in 9 days. This afternoon they suddenly got more intense, i started feeling nauseaus and dizzy. I have a dr appt booked, but not until the 24th.. should i go to the hospital? Whats going on?
title: Persistent headache... Pregnant, concerned!
